729223f-a.title: Richmond: Norden Street - Richmond Road
729223f-a.text:
Norden Street, west from Richmond Road. The two parallel white lines mark the conrse of the street.
May 6, 1926
P. L. Sperr
729223f-a.folder: Norden Street & Richmond Road, Staten Island, NY

729368f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Road - Norden Street
729368f-a.text:
(1)
1476 Richmond Road, east side, between Norden Street and T)elaware Street, showing the rerine House, home of the Staten Island Historical Society. It is the oldest house on Staten Island and part of it was probably erected before 1678. Thomas Stillwell was owner in 1685. Later the title passed to Nicholas Britton, and after his death to Walter Dongan. Still later Joseph Holmes acquired the property. His daughter, Ann, married Edward Perine, to whom her mother released it in 1764. During the Revolution it was the headquarters of Captain Coghlan. The hhouse Was sold to the Antiduarian Society in 1915.
1924
P. L. Sperr
729368f-a.folder: Richmond Road & Norden Street, Staten Island, NY

Later the title passed to Nicholas Britton, and after his death to Walter Dongan. Still later Joseph Holmes acquired the property. His daughter, Ann, married Edward Perine, to whom her mother released it in 1764. During the Revolution it was the headquarters of Captain Coghlan. 729369f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Road - Norden Street
729369f-b.text:
(1)  1476 Tichmond Noad, east side, between Norden Street and Delaware Street, showing the Perine House, part of which was erected before 1678. It is the oldest house on Staten Island.
1924
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view ef the houss, viewed eaetward.
April 7, 1938
P. L. Sperr
(3) An additional view, looking westward.
Aprii 7, 1938
P. L. Sperr
